item.title: Nvidia to license AI chip challenger Groq’s tech and hire its CEO
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: With Groq on its side, Nvidia is poised to become even more dominant in chip manufacturing.

item.title: The year data centers went from backend to center stage
item.dc:creator: Lucas Ropek
item.description: Data centers are no longer the boring tech issue they once were.

item.title: The European startup market’s data doesn’t match its energy — yet
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Szkutak
item.description: Europe's startup market hasn't produced meaningful numbers but there is reason to believe the data will start to change.

item.title: Why the operating room is ripe for AI, according to Akara
item.dc:creator: Russell Brandom, Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between, from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to […]

item.title: Waymo is testing Gemini as an in-car AI assistant in its robotaxis
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: Waymo is testing a Gemini-powered in-car AI assistant, per findings from a 1,200-line system prompt. The assistant can answer general knowledge questions, control certain in-cabin features, and more.

item.title: Italy tells Meta to suspend its policy that bans rival AI chatbots from WhatsApp
item.dc:creator: Ram Iyer
item.description: Italy has ordered Meta to suspend its policy that bans companies from using WhatsApp's business tools to offer their own AI chatbots on the popular chat app.

item.title: Can AI fix the operating room? This startup thinks so
item.dc:creator: Theresa Loconsolo
item.description: There’s plenty of hype around AI and robots in healthcare, but the problem that’s actually costing hospitals money right now is operating room coordination. Two to four hours of OR time is lost every single day, not because of the surgeries themselves, but because of everything in between from manual scheduling and coordination chaos to guesswork about room […]

item.title: John Carreyrou and other authors bring new lawsuit against six major AI companies
item.dc:creator: Amanda Silberling
item.description: These authors rejected Anthropic's class action settlement, arguing that "LLM companies should not be able to so easily extinguish thousands upon thousands of high-value claims at bargain-basement rates."

item.title: Marissa Mayer’s new startup Dazzle raises $8M led by Forerunner’s Kirsten Green
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Mayer launched Dazzle after shuttering her photo and contact management startup Sunshine. Green’s investment suggests Dazzle is poised for the coming wave of new AI-infused consumer businesses.

item.title: Amazon’s AI assistant Alexa+ now works with Angi, Expedia, Square, and Yelp
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The new integrations join other services like Yelp, Uber, OpenTable and others.

item.title: Lemon Slice nabs $10.5M from YC and Matrix to build out its digital avatar tech
item.dc:creator: Ivan Mehta
item.description: Digital avatar generation company Lemon Slice is working to add a video layer to AI chatbots with a new diffusion model that can create digital avatars from a single image.

item.title: OpenAI says AI browsers may always be vulnerable to prompt injection attacks
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Bellan
item.description: OpenAI says prompt injections will always be a risk for AI browsers with agentic capabilities, like Atlas. But the firm is beefing up its cybersecurity with an "LLM-based automated attacker."

item.title: Alphabet to buy Intersect Power to bypass energy grid bottlenecks
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: Alphabet is set to pay $4.75 billion in cash, plus debt, for the data center and clean energy developer.

item.title: ChatGPT launches a year-end review like Spotify Wrapped
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The experience includes awards, poems, and pictures referencing your year in chat.

item.title: Splat’s app uses AI to turn your photos into coloring pages for kids
item.dc:creator: Sarah Perez
item.description: The app turns your own photos into pages for your kids to color, via AI.

item.title: ChatGPT: Everything you need to know about the AI-powered chatbot
item.dc:creator: Kate Park, Kyle Wiggers, Cody Corrall, Alyssa Stringer
item.description: A timeline of ChatGPT product updates and releases, starting with the latest, which we’ve been updating throughout the year.

item.title: Waymo resumes service in San Francisco after robotaxis stall during blackout
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: Waymo suspended its SF robotaxi service on Saturday evening after a massive blackout appeared to leave many of its vehicles stalled on city streets.

item.title: OpenAI allows users to directly adjust ChatGPT’s enthusiasm level
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The tweaks allow users to further customize ChatGPT’s tone, on top of the existing ability to set a “base style and tone” — including the Professional, Candid, and Quirky tones that OpenAI added in November.

item.title: New York governor Kathy Hochul signs RAISE Act to regulate AI safety
item.dc:creator: Anthony Ha
item.description: The bill will require large AI developers to publish information about their safety protocols and report safety incidents to the state within 72 hours.

item.title: Ex-Splunk execs’ startup Resolve AI hits $1B valuation with Series A
item.dc:creator: Marina Temkin
item.description: The round was led by Lightspeed Venture Partners, according to people familiar with the deal.
